content: THE FEW Our Pledge LORD GOD ALMIGHTY You have seen me fit to serve your will in this material world. My soul has been washed in the blood of those who came before me. Steer me true and give me strength to continue when others may fail. Help me to achieve when others think it not possible. I have given my soul to exterminating evils in this life and beyond. I will love when love is in need. I will destroy when destruction be your will. If I falter, let your punishment be swift and fitting. If Saint Peter’s Eternal Guard will have me, I will have proven my mettle in the face of adversity and overcome tremendous horrors that others could not endure. I will never forget that your will was to see me through and grace me with the life as your servant. I speak not to others of my responsibilities and duties, for they not understand. I am your servant for eternity.

If Saint Peter’s Eternal Guard will have me, I will have proven my mettle in the face of adversity and overcome tremendous horrors that others could not endure. I will never forget that your will was to see me through and grace me with the life as your servant. I speak not to others of my responsibilities and duties, for they not understand. I am your servant for eternity.
title: THE FEW  my pledge

content: GREAT LORD FSM, ALMIGHTY You have seen me fit to serve your will in this culinary world. My Pirate’s soul has been washed in the marinara of those who came before me. Steer me true and give me strength to continue when others may fail. Help me to achieve when others think it not possible. I have given my soul to the enjoyment of good pasta. I will love when love is in the air. I will cook when gastronomy be your will. If I serve pasta other than al dente, let your punishment be swift and fitting. Even if Saint Rotini’s Eternal curl will leave me, I will have proven my mettle in the face of watery sauce and overcome tremendous ingredients that others could not endure. I will never forget that Your will was to see me through and grace me with the life as your servant. I am your cook and server for eternity. rAmen and rAmen

content: What is funny about all of this is that the war we are currently in...is in fact a holy war, but society has been numbed to the point of no return. Ask any terrorist if it is a holy war.... We have to start seeing things as they truly are if we want to make a difference. I am not what you would call a traditional christian fanatic...I drink, I smoke, hell I curse as well as any sailor. I was lucky enough to live through things that I probably would not have made it through had it not been for my faith.... Spend some time hunting and killing terrorists then come tell me this is not in fact a holy war.

content: quote: Originally posted by SteveDeHaven: quote: Originally posted by 20632193: If my enemy thinks I am fanatical as he is...that I have the same bent soul set to destroy what I believe is evil..then he may stop and think before attempting an attack on our innocent civilians. Oh, yeah. Religious fanaticism on one side is ALWAYS held in check by equal fanaticism on the other side!! [/sarcasm] That's the question for the ages, isn't it. But, the greatest changes in history don't always bear out the use of greater force to overcome fanatic behavior. I suspect that the type A individual would prefer force. That's what we try to instill into our Marines and Airborne, after all. That all-go, no-stop mentality is needed in traditional warfare. But, how is it working when these same people are asked to do the work of the Peace Corp, guiding convoys of commerce; building schools and hospitals; and otherwise trying to win hearts and minds? I wonder if the predatory bent isn't standing in the way of true ambassadorial activities. Is it really a good idea to send your best killers to win souls?

content: You are correct.......... I was truly being a bit sarcastic with all of this to begin with.... Most of what I say is not MY point of view, but is a point of which I have seen others hold. This discussion was meant as an experiment of sorts....Yeah..I Know..It was a bit edgy, but that was the point. I wanted to see if there are people out there that had the wherewithal to grasp specific topics of interest in my anthropological/sociological survey. Thanks to all of you for your input...Keep it going... this is interesting.

content: quote: Originally posted by 20632193: If my enemy thinks I am fanatical as he is...that I have the same bent soul set to destroy what I believe is evil..then he may stop and think before attempting an attack on our innocent civilians. I don't think they think we are fanatical enough. As far as I know, they don't think we are religious enough PERIOD. It's not "our" gods that worry them, its our secular humanist ideals and all encompassing propaganda about democracy that get's them worked up. Same thing that gets the fanatics in our country worked up. They (over there) could care less about "our" gods. They are not going to stop and think... "Ooooooh, their god is more fanatical than ours." There are no 'innocent civilians' in their scheme of things, just more reasons to eradicate the infidels and terrorize their like into submission to their view of their fanatical god. Never-the-less, who speaks for god is a very ancient debate... which imaginary superhero is greater. Marvel Comics couldn't do it better. So, I guess the most "real" god will win? I'd like to sit this one out... but I am afraid they'll both go after me given a chance to do so. So, I'm surrounded, regardless of what god names they hurl into space.

If the doc. got any interesting results from the lab she hasn't told me yet. Sometimes that's the way it works, the results get forwarded on the the next doc. in line and then you MIGHT find out, if, they deem you worthy of the knowledge that is!!! I figured as much!
